TEXT: The applicant , ORG , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is represented before the Court by Mr G. Dinç , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) did not designate an Agent for the purposes of the proceedings before the Court
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE the applicant retired from his post at ORG as a judge of the highest grade . Until CARDINAL DATE he worked as a lawyer .
On DATE , following a request made by the applicant , ORG and Prosecutors re - appointed him to ORG as a judge .

On DATE the applicant lodged an application with ORG and Prosecutors requesting that his salary be calculated on a different basis and be increased accordingly . He argued that the period during which he had practised as a lawyer ( i.e. DATE and DATE ) should be included into his civil service while calculating his salary .
On DATE ORG and Prosecutors dismissed the applicant ’s request .
The applicant lodged an application with ORG to annul the ORG ’s decision . On CARDINAL DATE ORG declined jurisdiction ratione loci and referred the case to ORG .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request . The court ruled that it was not competent to examine the applicant ’s claim as the decisions of ORG and Prosecutors were final and not subject to any judicial review . The applicant learned of this judgement on DATE .
On DATE the applicant appealed to ORG against the judgment of ORG .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal . The decision of ORG was served on the applicant on DATE .
On DATE the applicant requested the rectification of ORG decision . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s request for rectification of the decision .
According to LAW no . CARDINAL on ORG and Prosecutors , the Minister of ORG or interested parties can ask the ORG for the rectification of a decision within DATE from its notification .

LAW provides that the interested parties can object to the ORG ’s decision on rectification within DATE from the date on which the decision is served on them . A committee presided over by the Minister of ORG examines the objection . The decision of the committee is definite . No appeal against this final decision can be lodged before another judicial authority .
